Name: WurmUnlimited
Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Wurm Unlimited with or without the Server-ModLauncher and run it.
(You can also copy over the 'Creative' or 'Adventure' folder if you want to create a Server with the provided Servertool that comes with the game)

ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!

Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.

You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!
DonateText: If you like my work please

@attributes.Name: SteamCMD
@attributes.Description: Container Path: /serverdata/steamcmd

@attributes.Name: ServerFiles
@attributes.Description: Container Path: /serverdata/serverfiles

@attributes.Name: GAME_ID
@attributes.Description:
The GAME_ID that the container download at startup.
(https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

@attributes.Name: Steam-Username
@attributes.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

@attributes.Name: Validate Installation
@attributes.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

@attributes.Name: Steam-Password
@attributes.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

@attributes.Name: UPD1
@attributes.Description: Container Port: 8766

@attributes.Name: UDP2
@attributes.Description: UDP Queryport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to click an 'Show more settings ...

@attributes.Name: TCP1
@attributes.Description: Container Port: 8766

@attributes.Name: TCP2
@attributes.Description: TCP Gameport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new TCP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to click an 'Show more settings ...

@attributes.Name: Enable Mod Launcher
@attributes.Description: To enable the Server-ModLauncher set it to 'true' (without quotes) otherwise leave it blank.

@attributes.Name: Servrname
@attributes.Description: Name of the Server

@attributes.Name: Server Password
@attributes.Description: Server Password to join

@attributes.Name: Admin Password
@attributes.Description: Your Admin Password

@attributes.Name: Max Players
@attributes.Description: Define the maximum players on the server

@attributes.Name: GAME_PORT
@attributes.Description: Container Variable: GAME_PORT

@attributes.Name: QUERYPORT
@attributes.Description: Container Variable: WU_QUERYPORT

@attributes.Name: Homeserver
@attributes.Description: If set to 'true' (without quotes) Server is a homeserver and belongs to a single kingdom.

@attributes.Name: HOMEKINGDOM
@attributes.Description: If you're using the Adventure base, use 1, 2, or 3. || If you're using Creative, use 4. || Kingdom numbers: 0 - No kingdom | 1 - Jen-Kellon | 2 - Mol-Rehan | 3 - Horde of the Summoned | 4 - Freedom

@attributes.Name: GAME_MODE
@attributes.Description: Choose between 'Adventure' and 'Creative' (without quotes) or copy your own map to the root of the serverfolder and define the name of the mapfolder here

@attributes.Name: LOGINSERVER
@attributes.Description: If set to 'false' the server is intended to connect to another server who is the loginserver.

@attributes.Name: EPICSETTINGS
@attributes.Description: If set to true the server will follow the rules of the Epic servers in Wurm Online

@attributes.Name: Extra Startup Parmeters
@attributes.Description: Enter your extra start up commands for the server if needed.

@attributes.Name: UID
@attributes.Description: Container Variable: UID

@attributes.Name: GID
@attributes.Description: Container Variable: GID
